abstract.t: This draft defines a layer-2 API in C-language for IP paging. API is presented in the form of callback functions. Whenever a significant event takes place in layer-2, upper layers are notified using triggers, which can be implemented using callback functions. Network and upper layer protocols can use these callbacks to fine tune layer-3 protocols. Paging API defines callback functions for dormant mode related information, sent from layer-2 to layer-3. API also defines a set of attributes, which define static properties of the underlying network. Each layer-2 technology may use this hierarchy to specify its properties and limitations.
